39460099.review: Toonstruck - это одна из моих любимых стареньких игр, наравне с Monkey Island и Broken Sword. Очень рада была прибрести ее в Steam, прагала до потолка! Эпизод с книгами в 96 году проходила месяца 2 из-за ошибки в переводе болтовни птицы)) С удовольствием прошла ее снова! Жаль, что вторая часть игры так и не увидела свет!

39293098.review:
Eine Kindheitserinnerung .. Jedenfalls für mich. Wer klassische Point and Klick Adventures mag wird auch dieses mögen. Es hat sehr viel Humor und Charme. Natürlich muss man bedenken, aus welchem Jahr das Spiel kommt und daher ist grafisch nicht viel drin aber trotzdem überzeugt das Spiel von der Story her. Auch viele der Rätsel sind nicht von schlechten Eltern. 
Da muss schonmal auf kleinste Details geachtet werden um weiter zu kommen. Trotz der comicartigen Aufmachung des Spiels ist es doch eher für ältere Spieler angedacht, da es doch viele Anspielungen enthält die vielleicht nicht jeder seinem Kind zumuten möchte. Hinzu kommt, dass die Steam-Version ausschließlich auf Englisch verfügbar ist. Doch wen dies nicht stört der wird mit dem Spiel sicher seinen Spaß haben.

Ich kann es nur empfehlen gerade aus nostalgischer Sicht.

Viel Spaß in der Welt von Cutopia euer Sphinx

39109261.review:
Played it again after 15 years and not disappointed. The same feels after such a long time. Take a glorious plot, cool animation, great  Christopher Lloyd and funny jokes. So what we've got? Beautiful 90's click and point quest which is called "Toonstruck". Highly recommend to play this amazing game!

10/10 Flux

39070926.review:
Toonstruck is a point-and-click adventure game that has caught my eye for quite a long time now. I was quite glad that I bought it at a discount! Anyways, after playing this classic masterpiece which combines live-action and 2D animation, like Who Framed Roger Rabbit? and Looney Tunes: Back in Action. Here are my pros and cons:

PROS:
- An all-star cast?! Oh, joy! And I happen to find some familiar voice actors that rung a bell in my head!
 -- Christopher Lloyd (who voiced as Judge Doom from Who Framed Roger Rabbit?)
 -- Tim Curry (who, surprisingly, voiced Lord Dragaumus from The Mighty Ducks cartoon series)
 -- Dan Castellaneta (who famously voiced Homer Simpson from The Simpsons cartoon series!)
 -- Dom DeLuise (who voiced Tiger from An American Tail and An American Tail: Fieval Goes West)
 -- Corey Burton (who, surprisingly, voiced the english dub of Doublehelix from Asterix and the Vikings!)
 -- Jeff Bennett (who voiced as Johnny Bravo from the cartoon of the exact same name!)
 -- Jim Cummings (who voiced as Mr. Bumpy from an old-as-heck cartoon, Bump in the Night)
 -- Rob Paulsen (who voiced as Squishington from an old-as-heck cartoon, Bump in the Night)
 -- and Tress MacNeille (who still voices as Daisy Duck from all that is Disney!)

- Lovely cast of cartoon characters, such as a bird-brain of a royal scientist and a malevolent villain.

- Puzzles and mini-games were very challenging, yet decently fair and possible to beat.

- Neat soundtrack that suits its cartoon-y atmosphere.

- Amazing cartoon references to find, such as WACME (which is a clear reference to Looney Tunes' Acme Corp.)

CONS:
- Some or most of the game were cut-out during its development. For instance, some of the bits on the high-quality trailer here were not found during gameplay, such as this Vincent Van Gogh-esque cartoon character.

- Mouse sensitivity is too 'wacky', if you get my meaning, making you try to move your mouse softly rather than moving it quite fast.

- F1 button doesn't seem to work, as every time I push it, it won't give me the options screen like it said it would do.

- No sequel? Aww... Better get some more people and fans of this game to make it a reality then.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

My final verdict of Toonstruck is that I really enjoyed playing through this game for almost 6 hours time, plus it would at least give me lessons on how would I even try to make a game like this. The cutscenes were both classic and wonderful, from the live-action world to the cartoon world. For that, I would give it a 8.75/10.

If you like point-and-click adventure games such as Monkey Island and Discworld. Hurry up, buy this game, and put it in your collection already! You won't regret it!

39061579.review: This game was in my childhood. Since I was very fond of the film Who Framed Roger Rabbit and also I'm very like Christopher Lloyd, these two universes pleased to me. Some kind of weird and strange humor, something reminiscent of The Ren and Stimpy Show, as well as the Angry Beavers. Excellent animation and great music (This is something to play for and ofcourse great Mr. Lloyd,). The plot is a bit strange and contains hidden subtexts. There are complex tasks, over which you can seriously get stuck. In general, the impression is good. I recommend this game for fans of Sam & Max or Day Of The Tentacle

38909497.review:
Cuando hablamos de juegos clásicos siempre podemos encontrarnos con dos tipos de juegos. O bien aquellos que en su día fueron realmente buenos pero que hoy en día son bastante limitados jugablemente hablando, o bien aquellos que aún teniendo más de 20 años a sus espaldas todavía son joyas independientemente del tiempo que haya pasado.

Las aventuras gráficas tienen mucho ganado en este aspecto, porque su sistema jugable apenas ha variado desde los 90, por lo que disfrutar de los clásicos no varía prácticamente en nada, salvo por los gráficos, pero poco más.

Toonstruck es un claro ejemplo de esto, y es una de las mejores aventuras de corte cómico que podrás encontrar jamás. A finales de los 80 y principios de los 90 no era infrecuente incluir a actores reales con dibujos animados, tal y como se vio en "¿Quién engaño a Roger Rabbit?" con  Bob Hoskins o "Cool World" con Kim Basinger, así que esta fue la fórmula elegida para crear esta fantástica aventura, la cual protagoniza Christopher Lloyd, famoso por su papel de "Doc" en "Regreso al Futuro" o por su papel de "Fétido" en "La Familia Addams".

El argumento, sin entrar en muchos detalles para que tú lo descubras, va de un dibujante que es obligado en su empresa a crear más personajes para una serie de dibujos, y tienen que ser parecidos a la gran estrella de la cadena: una conejita adorable y cursi a más no poder. Él accede a regañadientes porque tiene otras ideas más interesantes, pero esa noche se queda dormido sobre su escritorio y es teletransportado al mundo de dibujos que él creó, donde le acompañará su primer dibujo creado: "Flux Tarambana". A partir de ahí, tendrás que descubrir qué pasa en ese mundo e intentar arreglarlo todo para poder volver a casa. 

Y mientras estamos en ello, podremos recrearnos la vista estupendamente, ya que todo el juego está pintado a mano, exceptuando el personaje principal que fue digitalizado. El resultado final es grandioso, incluso hoy en día, creando una atmósfera tal que parezca que estemos jugando y viendo una pelicula de dibujos animados, y no serán infrecuentes las cinemáticas realmente divertidas y desternillantes que le otorgan al título un plus de calidad y entretenimiento. Realmente el aspecto técnico, para ser un juego de 1996, es simplemente espectacular.

Pero lo mejor de todo es que ese es su aspecto menos importante. El juego como tal es magnífico. Los puzles están realmente bien implementados, y no son ni sencillos ni demasiado complejos, ni tampoco rebuscados y sin sentido. Y eso tiene un gran mérito, porque el mundo donde se desarrolla la aventura está totalmente loco y en frenesí constante, algo que podría haber provocado que los puzles carecieran del mismo sentido que sus propios personajes, pero realmente no es así, y todo funciona perfectamente y no podrás encontrar ni un solo puzle que no tenga sentido.

Por su parte la música y el doblaje son realmente buenos, pero lamentablemente el juego en Steam no está en español. Sin embargo, si tienes alguna copia del juego original, puedes sustituir los archivos sin temor porque todo funcionará perfectamente y podrás disfrutar de esta extraordinaria aventura en perfecto castellano. Y lo de "perfecto" es importante, porque rara vez podrás oír un doblaje en español tan soberbio en un videojuego. Es simplemente magistral el trabajo que hicieron. Encontrarte con el espantapájaros homosexual doblado de esa manera, o con la vaca masoquista, con el tabernero irlandés-vasco, o con cualquier tipo de personaje realmente, porque ni uno solo de ellos tiene un doblaje en español inferior al 10. Eso está garantizado. 

Así que resumiendo, tenemos unos gráficos y animaciones realmente trabajadas, una historia desternillante y entretenida, un sistema jugable realmente equilibrado, ni muy difícil ni muy fácil, unos puzles lógicos, una música muy acertada con el universo que recrea y un doblaje, con bricolaje, simplemente excepcional. ¿Qué más necesitas? Poco más diría yo.

Toonstruck se ganó por derecho propio ser una de las mejores aventuras gráficas que han salido al mercado, y ahora la podemos volver a disfrutar igualmente sin perder ni un ápice de calidad y entretenimiento. Sin duda es un juego obligado para cualquier fan de las aventuras gráficas, independientemente de la edad que tenga.

38876630.review: A very funny point-and-click adventure game, although some of the cute symbols in the plot can overshadow many adult themes. The game likes to mock the player, which seems annoying at first, but then comes to poke fun at many cliches in other games within the genre. The cast of characters in Toonstruck is very memorable, with both protragonists putting up with each other in a painful way that contains amusing dialogue. If you are a fan of the movie "Who Framed Roger Rabbit", or the Sierra games, you may enjoy this title!

38109512.review:
Wonderful game full of nostaligia for those who played it in the nineties, but an excellent point-and-click even if you didn't. Cutscenes are low res due to the year of production but the art holds up suprisingly well; voice acting is superb with a great performance from Christopher Lloyd as the lead. It says a lot that so many people (including me) still have their original CDs from back in the day (but convenience of steam = great)
Additionally, anyone with a taste for classicla music will notice beautiful passages from all sorts of famous pieces used as the backdrop to the game; wonderful on very level.

36837190.review: This game is absolutely amazing and I’m not sure why there is not a second one! I voted it for the "“THE WHOOOAAAAAAA, DUDE! 2.0” AWARD so I think it should win as this game was brilliantly made for its time! And it is very well casted; especially love Christopher Lloyd’s part!

34784437.review:

I envy any one who hasn't played this game before, because this, along with games such as Broken Sword, Monkey Island et al represents part of the golden age of point and click adventures.

33841394.review: I JUST LOVE IT SO MUCH!

33557644.review:
De las mejoras aventuras graficas de su epoca. Original y divertida y con un monton de guiños al mundo del cine y la series. Como guinda protagonizado por Christopher Lloyd y el malo doblado por Tim curry. Un ataque de nostalgia sin fin. Lastima que cuando ya conoces los puzles se vuelve un poco corto pero merece la pena.

PD: Aunque parezca para niños, no lo es (si no me creeis, fijaos en la oveja y la vaca)

33553348.review:
14/10 would definitely recommend.

This was absolutely fantastic. I love point and click adventures, and this is certainly one of the best I've ever seen. It has celebrity voice actors and a lot of variety in the puzzles.

More specifically, the story and visuals are amazing. Live action people interacting with cartoon characters isnt an original concept, but Toonstruck is now my favourite example of the trope. Its like it took the irreverent moxy of Cool World and applied it to the vibrant colours silliness of Roger Rabbit. And while I definitely wouldnt consider it a nostalgia experience (I didnt play the game when it was first released) its full of 90s video game stock sound effects, and a lot of the over-the-top slapstick cartoon cliches which seem to have gone out of favour in contemporary cartoons. 

There was a sequel planned but never released; buy Toonstruck to prove to publishers that there is an audience who would pay to see more of the adventures of Live Action Christopher Lloyd.

33475140.review: Very Good Game, i line this up with Broke Sword, Monkey Island and the best of Point and Click Adventure Games! It has a great sense of Humor and style .. like cool cartoons from my childhood. And it features  Christopher Lloyd and the ACME brand :D !! I LOVE THIS GAME , PLEASE SOMEHOW FINISH TOONSTRUCK 2!

32635271.review: Das wohl beste Spiel aus meiner Kindheit - für Point&Click Liebhaber absolut empfehlenswert!! :-)

32184546.review:
A very nice game. Used to play it a long time ago, enjoyed it as much today. This version doesn't have updated graphics, but the drawn cartoony style remains charming even today and Chrostopher Lloyd is fun to watch, even if he's very pixelated. Voice cast is amazing! Tress MacNeille is great as always, Frank Welker, Rob Paulsen, Jim Cummings, Tim Curry.

The game has a great visual style, like the 90s drawn cartoons. Tiny Toons comes to mind. Yet there are more darker designs and sexual innuendos. Character design is great - especially like Miss Fortune, Nefarious and both versions of Marge.

There's no hint system in game, but the puzzles are logical. There's no way to highlight all active objects you can interact with, but the cursor changes to an appropriate icon and there's a text message at the bottom if you mouse over a clickable object. Right clicking the exits on most screens immediately puts you to the next area, which lets you traverse anywhere really quickly.

I highly recommend this game to anyone who likes quests and 90s cartoons, maybe 13+ as there are some mildly disturbing visuals later in the game (aside from usual cartoon slapstick violence).

32115064.review: Офигенная игра с достаточно сложными загадками. Знаменитый актёр и забавные мульты затягивают. Советую любителям квестов.

32037730.review:

I loved this game a lot and i'm happy to have it in my collection.

31506294.review: Bir klasik, tek kelime ile MÜKEMMEL!!!!!

31201594.review: Моя любимая игра раннего детства  (перепроходил раз 6) и мой любимый квест по сей день. Даже старенькое двухдисковое издание от Фаргуса имеется.  Увидев в стиме... естественно решил поддержать разработчиков денежкой,заодно ещё раз пройду. Удивлён, что всего 1 русскоязычный отзыв.  Неужели так мало людей знает/помнит про эту замечательную игру?

31089399.review:
卡通总动员，一款很老的游戏了，但是画面由于是卡通的形式，即便放到现在来也是不逊色的。当时由于谁杀了兔子罗尼、空中大灌篮等作品的推出，真人结合卡通也是一个不错的卖点。我个人很喜欢这种风格，但是现在反而很少看到这样的作品了。主要原因应该还是成本的关系。STEAM上的版本是优化过的，我记得之前玩的时候过场动画是隔行显示的，而现在的过场动画画面更佳了。之前玩这个游戏的时候是高中，我有一个同学在没有攻略的前提下将这个游戏通关，我们当时是惊为天人的。毕竟我到现在最后部分没有攻略也是打不过去。这个事情让我首次感觉到了智商这东西不是公平的。

  这个游戏之前买盗版盘的时候是有两张CD的。不得不说，两张CD之间差距很大。CD1的田园可爱风格和CD2的古堡完全是不同的感觉。然而即便是前一张CD的内容，也并不适合和孩子一起玩。母牛被邪恶机控制后的SM当时对年少的我造成了相当的震撼。
 何况这个游戏，作为游戏是虎头蛇尾的一作。前面在商店里还能慢慢看产品的杀伤力演示，但是CD2中根本没有这样的闲暇时间了。CD2中的内容更像是赶工赶出来的一样。包括结尾，这样撞一下就能让闪电小子复原也太扯了。还有无论是真邪恶BOSS还是BUNNY BUNNY都没有一个交代，我最纠结的就是没能看到青蛙回家后团聚的一幕，这真让人很不爽。

    总结：优良的画风、优美的音乐和CD1中的吐槽是玩这个游戏的动力
               糟糕的剧情和过于繁杂的道具导致这个游戏无法成为优秀的作品。
               CD1部分可以得7分，CD2部分5分，加上情怀分，这个游戏我还是给个好评

29749325.review: AWESOME! Trust me a good long point and click game thats funny and just the right level of problem solving. I wish more was like this! I couldn't find a thing wrong with this game, seriously fun and worth every penny and I'm a good judge of games as I've beaten almost ALL of the new or popular titles out there as these are my favorite type of games.

29607719.review:
Ignore my play time on this game. 

I only just found out it was on steam yesterday after my sister sent me a link! The look on my face... I was just too excited to be able to try it again. :) So I bought it the day after haha. [i] Nostalgic![/i]

It was one of the best games I played back then. :D My family and I loved it a lot. I thought I'd test it and see if it worked alright, and it did so far! :) I remember always trying to get it to work just so play it hehe. 

It has not been remastered like some may have thought, and I don't care. I'm just glad to be able to play a classic game again after all these years. I've always been hoping for a second game of Toonstruck, but yeah... Doubt it'll happen... :( Though, who knows? I've read that it might happen. Would love it if it does.

Toonstruck is a funny game, with quite a bit of funny moments and great characters. I've always loved the cutscenes in this game as well that I still remember clearly. :) And the game runs great for me! Even though I just watched the intro and clicked a few things before writing this review. 

I hope more people will buy this game and experience the cutopia, cartoon world. :P I mean, who doesn't want to hang around with Flux Wildly while saving cutopians from the evil Count Nefarious? :P I wouldn't want their cuteness to go away! :D

29279662.review:
The best Point & Click adventure ever.
Yes, I am talking from a nostalgic point of view (ignore my short playing time).

29167230.review:
This game was released when games just released 3D, leaving this one very undiscovered. I feel that the game deserve way more praise than it gets. Its a very enjoyable game if you like games like Curse of the Monkey Island (not AS good) or Sam & Max (almost as good).

I had fun playing it. Would say on the con side that the ending could've been even better, and maybe a little bit longer. Then again I played it way back in the day when I was a kid so that probably had something to do with the fast playtrough.

If you enjoy oldschool point n click-games, and for this one with a bit of a dark humor-twist you will enjoy this one.

It's just so enjoyable to see the combination of weird humor, bad acting, good acting, good writing, bad writing and everything.

7+ / 10 from me

28845022.review: I know im going to like this game, but could someone help me configure it so it looks proper like the trailer videos?

28810495.review: One of the best point and click games of my childhood. Loved playing it again. Would love for the second part to be released.

28760265.review:
I was hoping to be able to replay this classic adventure game. It has been two decades since I first tried this game, and it has aged well. I'll cut to the chase because I just want to give this game a thumbs up. I assume Christopher Lloyd is a character designer in an animation company. Lloyd's character, Drew Blanc, receives a task from his boss to design a whole bunch of new cartoon characters for a new animation show and is given only one day to finish the job. Frustrated and exhausted, Drew Blanc falls a sleep on his work desk and later on wakes up to find himself in the toon world that requires his help on an important matter. 

Pros:

- Character design and animation
- Location art 
- Voice acting
- Puzzles and well hidden hints on how to solve them


Cons:

- Christopher Lloyd's awkward acting at times
- The plot line of how Lloyd is connected to the toon world feels absurd and abrupt

28706607.review:
One of the better comedic point and click games of all time, and with voice acting from Christopher Lloyd and Dan Castellaneta to name but a few of the highly talented and easily recognisable members of the cast, its fair to say you won't be disappointed.

The artwork has aged remarkably well considering how old the game is, but unfortunately the animation of the characters is choppy which is the only showing of it's age.

The puzzles aren't the most complicated in the genre, but the comedy value of this game is what makes it stand out and hold it's own, the characters whom you meet are interesting with their own mannerisms and personalities. If you were on the fence about this product I would recommend trying it definitely, or at least watch a few gameplay videos to see if it is for you.

28668134.review: Although almost 21 years old at this point, Toonstruck continues to be an enjoyable experience time and time again

28448834.review:
A blast from the past for sure. ToonStruck is a fun point and click game from the mid 90's complete with your very own sarcastic Christopher Lloyd to control.

I've played this game time and time again as a teen and it's still as charming as ever graphics are showing their age but if you are into 90s cartoons then it won't bother you, what you see in the trailer and images is really what you get. Worth checking out! this gem deserved better!

One thing you have to know is that the (options) menu was removed for this port. you can still save and load your game (use F5 and F6) as well as all the hot keys functions but to quit you'll have to do it the hard way.

28430046.review: Was so happy to be able to play this game again! really hope that it is one day remastered and part 2 is complete... favorite game ever.

27781875.review: Game owns. What more needs to be said?

27683832.review:
One of the formative games of my teen years, Toonstruck is equal parts Lucasarts adventure, Roger Rabbit, and a junkie clown shooting up in an alley. If it sounds insane, it really is, but in all the best ways. I'm not sure which part I love the most; the characters, the jokes, the frenetic animations, or the beautifully drawn locations. And don't forget the star cast! That said, it's a 90s era adventure game, so puzzle solutions can swing from obvious to obscure, but at least there are guides this time around.

Bottom line: If you liked The Curse of Monkey Island and somehow missed Toonstruck, now is a great time to fix that.

27663245.review: Simply bonkers! I love it! Thanks to Steam I can finally play this game again after years of compatability issues with newer operating systems! :D

27360298.review:
One of the best games of all time. And yet I so rarely hear about it. 

Christopher Lloyd, Ben Stein, TIm Curry? And amazing story, puzzles, and fun?! 

Works perfectly on Steam, and I've been waiting for the port for YEARS. Only complaint is the resolution which only has 1996 to blame. Hopefully someone will remaster this at some point. Regardless. This classic is PURE gold.

If you haven't played it, please buy this immedietely.

27184044.review: I don't normally rate games on here but this is a game i grew up with and it being re-released for people who didnt grow up with it to play to justify there being a sequel...definitely a cool thing. Getting to show my little sister a game i grew up playing is always nice too

26823505.review: Where has this been all my life?  With actors I love and a zany cartoon world people of all ages will love, i am saddened I had not discovered this back when it first came out.  The publisher did a good job at not updating or changing muxh of anything (besides the options menu but that's nothing to be too concerned over)  A timeless classic point & click that i will be enjoying for many days to come.

26759343.review:
Замечательный мультяшный квест, использующий совмещение мультипликации и оцифрованного видео (в стиле Кто подставил кролика Роджера ), последнее представлено оцифрованной фигуркой главного героя (исполняет замечательный актер Док браун, он же Кристофер Ллойд).
По интерфейсу и антуражу это «классический» квест стиля «point and click» с видом от третьего лица.
Плюсы: Приятная графика (особенно если учесть что это квест и вышел он в 1996 году). Хороший сюжет, который характерен для такого жанра. Управление простое и понятное; и кончено юмор (куда без него).
Минусы: Нету продолжения этой игры
Так что если хотите провести приятно время и отдохнуть то не проходите мимо  этой замечательной игры.

26687679.review:
Got to love seeing old school 90s games here on Stream.

Great voice acting, hilarious characters and more. The puzzles are releatively simple, but that is not a bad thing for a game like this. As someone else before me said, this is a lot like Who Framed Rodger Rabbit. 

If you like comedic point and click adventures, this one is for you. The downside is the control mappings aren't accurate and the only one that I've found which works is F5 to save. 

To exit the game you can hit the Windows key if you have a laptop/computer which has it, and close the game via right click. 

It runs well and so far i have not run into any glitches.

26668142.review:
[h1]Give us the whole game![/h1]
I originally picked this up in the mid-90s and loved it then. It’s colourful, funny and you become immersed in the toon world and its characters. This title is up there with other point and click puzzle games like Monkey Island.

Unfortunately, they cut a load of content out just before the game was released (you can see some of it in the video on Steam). They then planned to release it as a sequel but because the game was not marketed well it never happened.

Buy this game and get involved on [url=https://www.facebook.com/groups/140186316013394/]social media[/url] to help get Toonstruck 2 released (or even a HD remake)

p.s. Don'y forget to nominate this game for the "best use of a farm animal" Steam award!

26642351.review:
[H1]Een underdog die meer waardering verdient[/H1]
Toonstruck is één van de drie spellen die Burst media in opdracht van Virgin Interactive Entertainment maakt aan het eind van de negentiger jaren. Oorspronkelijk was het de bedoeling dat het een veel groter spel zou worden, maar de tijd die nodig was voor alle animaties en het beperkte budget noopten Burst ertoe veel materiaal uit het spel te snijden en opzij te zetten voor Toonstruck 2, dat er tot op de dag van vandaag nooit gekomen is. Helaas kreeg Toonstruck niet de marketing die het nodig had en lag al na korte tijd in de budgetbakken. Ik kocht in 1998 een fysiek exemplaar voor minder (inflatie niet meegerekend) dan ik er nu voor heb betaald bij de grote Virgin store in Rotterdam en in de jaren erna heb ik regelmatig exemplaren zien liggen voor een paar gulden. 
Je zou dus kunnen denken dat het spel afgeraffeld is, of heel erg kort of van B kwaliteit, met een onervaren cast en goedkope animatie. Maar het tegenovergestelde is waar. De animatie is van tekenfilmkwaliteit en hetzelfde geldt voor de voicecast. Wel is de animatie blokkerig (640x480 was het HD van eind jaren negentig), maar als je eenmaal begonnen bent met spelen, zal dat je nog amper opvallen. Met een filter in ScummVM ziet het spel er zeer acceptabel uit. Aan alle animaties is veel zorg en aandacht besteed, zodat je het gevoel hebt een interactieve tekenfilm te spelen. 
De voicecast is daar ook debet aan. Destijds waren acteurs als Christopher Lloyd, Ben Stein, Tim Curry en Dom Deluise al gevestigde namen, maar de meeste hebben in de afgelopen twintig jaar nog veel meer indrukwekkende CV's opgebouwd (voor zover ze niet zijn overleden). Ook de rest van de stemmen werd gedaan door stemacteurs die destijds al hun sporen hadden verdiend met stemwerk in zo ongeveer elke populaire tekenfilm. Dan Castenaletta, Rob Paulsen, Jim Cummings, Frank Welker, Tress MacNeil en Jeff Bennet waren destijds al verantwoordelijk voor een groot aantal bekende stemmen uit ieders favouriete tekenfilm en ook zij zijn allemaal nog volop actief. De namen zeggen je misschien niets, maar als je hun CV opzoekt op bijvoorbeeld Wikipedia of IMDB zul je zien dat zij verantwoordelijk zijn voor een groot aantal zeer bekende tekenfilmstemmen, van Homer Simpson tot aan Megatron, ze zijn bijna allemaal vertegenwoordigd in Toonstruck. Er zijn meer spellen met een indrukwekkende voicecast (Orion Burger of de originele Gabriel Knight Sins of the Father bijvoorbeeld), maar Toonstruck spant wat dat betreft echt de kroon. En dat zorgt er ook voor dat alle figuren die je tegenkomt veel persoonlijkheid uitstralen en hun rol met veel humor spelen. Van de melodramatische Fluffy Fluffy Bun Bun die volkomen van slag is, omdat iemand haar een suikerspin heeft gegeven in plaats van popcorn (oh ja, en haar speelweide is ook volledig verziekt, maar dat terzijde). Tot de Carecrow, die zich zorgen maakt om de arme kraaien die hij moet verzorgen en die op zoek is naar een nieuwe outfit (gelukkig is hij niet veeleisend: "I want something I can wear all day and all year 'round, it doesn't have to be out of this world, with no hair out of place, nothing too sappy and no bells and whistles, no big top and definitelly no cross dressing"). Of Scratch en Sniff die allerlei levensgevaarlijke uitvindingen op elkaar uittesten (in een parodie op Tom en Jerry en ACME). Het zijn stuk voor stuk indrukwekkende en grappige personages. Het spel is doorspekt van subtiele en minder subtiele humor, van eenvoudige woordspelingen (de Baker boys heten bijvoorbeeld: Dough, Ray en Me) tot zwarte humor en zelfspot. 
De puzzels zijn niet echt moeilijk, maar je moet regelmatig out of the box denken en je hebt vanaf het begin van het spel toegang tot een groot aantal locaties, voorwerpen en puzzels om op te lossen. Dus je hoeft je geen moment te vervelen. 
Ook qua lengte is het geen spel dat je even op een zaterdagmiddag uitspeelt. Reken op 12-20 uur om het spel uit te spelen. Het spel eindigt met een duidelijke opzet voor een deel 2, maar voelt niet onaf. 
Samen met de spellen van Lucasart (Day of the Tentacle, Sam and Max Hit the Road, Full Throttle), Sierra online (Gabriel Knight, Phantasmagoria) en Westwood (Legend of Kyrandia), hoort Toonstruck thuis in mijn top 10 favoriete 'point and click adventure games'.

26641292.review:
Toonstruck, a game that has been in my heart ever since I was a child.
To be honest, the only reason I bought this game on steam, is so I could write a Review about it and show other people what an amazing game they’re missing out on.

Toonstruck is a gem for all lovers of Cartoon, classic humor, puns, point & click Adventures, great character design and amazing Soundtrack that we have all heard before with old symphonies that are often used in cartoons. It also shows many similarities to movies like “Who framed Roger Rabbit”

This game, even if 20 years old by now, holds up fantastic. If I would have picked it up today, I would have probably never noticed its age. It shares the same quality as games like Monkey Island and it also does a really good job on staying creative and inventive. For some reason the game never got really popular, which is not just a shame but also a mystery because of the very good cast the game has, with people like Christopher Llyod.

In this game you start as the artist Drew, who has missed his deadline of drawing cute Bunnies for a TV show. And then the game sucks you in. Literally, you get sucked into the TV and become part of the world you drew yourself. Within this funny and bouncy, overly friendly and helpful cartoon world you get asked to do many tasks before you can get help to find back home. 

The game works over typical point & click elements, the puzzles are usually very easy figured out and even if you do get stuck at times, some thinking and try and error will eventually always lead you somewhere. You also can use your best Friend Flux to solve several puzzles and the story will leave you open for some great surprises as well. You’ll also get rewarded with tons of very beautiful cutscenes, funny voicelines and lots of little great animations.

The Steam version runs over ScumVM and works fluent and nice. The only downside is that the original menu doesn’t exists anymore and you can only save over ScumVM via F5 and F6. Other than that, everything seems to be working quite good. 
That’s all I can say so far, I really hope the release on Steam made some people interested in the game, because if you haven’t played it yet, you really missed out on an amazing adventure in the world of cartoons. 

And who knows, maybe Toonstruck 2 will happen, one day far from today.

26635909.review: Great for people who enjoy point and click adventures!

26621666.review:
[h1]Toonstruck[/h1]
[u]Pure Nostalgia from 1996[/u]

First off if you enjoyed the point and click titles of the nineties like [b]Monkey Island[/b], [b]Broken Sword[/b], [b]Tex Murphy[/b] etc, and like great comedic actors like the legendary [b]Christopher Lloyd[/b] the extremley funny & versatile [b]Dan Castellaneta & Tress MacNeille[/b] and the ever awesome [b]Tim Curry[/b] to name a few. Buy this game!

I adore this game as its pure nostalgia for me. I still have my original CD from 1996 and have fond memories of it. Even 20 years on this game has lost no charm and is still fantastic to play.

Great Story, great characters, great soundtrack with major earworms like [b]Spooky Scherzo[/b], [b]Happy go livley[/b] and [b]The William Tell Overture[/b] to name a few.

The Steam version seems to be perfectley optimised so far and plays without fault. It runs on ScummVM which is nice and stable. The only thing that has changed because of running on ScummVM is that the F1 action to bring up the menu does not work and the save/load functions of F5 and F6 have been replaced by ScummVM's own inbuilt save option. So once I have saved the game I find the easiest way to exit the game is to simply ALT+F4 as you cannot reaccess the menu once ingame. This however is such a minor issue that it does not bother me.

There have been rumours brewing for the last 18 or so years of a sequel, talks have been held with Keith Arem and other people and apprentley there was loads of material left over from the original. So if you are a fan buy this game and help support the possibilty of a sequel. You can see the community behind the Toonstruck 2 movement here.

[h1]Toonstruck 2 Fan Project[/h1]
http://toonstruck2.games4um.de/t1608f2034-We-re-back.html

[h1]The Toonstruck 2 Petition Facebook group[/h1]
https://www.facebook.com/groups/140186316013394/


[h1]General Plot Overview[/h1]
[u]No Spoilers even if it is 20 years old[/u]

Drew Blanc is a cartoon animator and the original creator of the Fluffy Fluffy Bun Bun Show. This show has been an unprecedented ten year success for his company, but in reality the many cute talking rabbits that star in the show sicken him. His self-revered creation, Flux Wildly, a wise-talking and sarcastic small purple character, has been denied the chance of starring in his own show. Drew's boss, Sam Schmaltz, sets him the task of designing more bunnies to co-star in the Fluffy Fluffy Bun Bun Show by the next morning. However, the depressed animator soon nods off, suffering from acute artist's block. He wakes early the next morning to inexplicably find his television switched on, announcing the Fluffy Fluffy Bun Bun Show. Suddenly, Drew is mysteriously drawn into the television screen and transported to an idyllic two-dimensional cartoon world populated by his own creations, among many other cartoon characters. He soon befriends Flux Wildly and discovers that this fictional paradise is being ravaged by a ruthless new character with a devastating weapon of evil, a flying machine equipped with a ray beam that mutates the pleasant, childish landscape and its inhabitants into dark, twisted and mean counterpart versions of themselves. He is tasked with hunting down and stopping this madman, thereby restoring peace and harmony to the land, in return for safe passage back to three dimensional reality.

If you have found this review helpful leave a like and buy this gem!

"and please by all means, shove off Sir!"
[u]The Footman[/u]

[i][u][b]Freerider-Dave[/b][/u][/i]

26622480.review:
First off: Don't mind the low playtime I have on it, I already played the game many times before, however I only booted up the steam version for a minute to see if there are any issues, or differences from the gog-version (there aren't)

Toonstruck is an absolutely amazing point&click adventure game. Gorgeous visuals with beautiful animation, great performances, and a thoroughly enjoyable story with fun dialogue make this game a true hidden gem. Any fan of the genre owes it to themselves to play this game.

There are some very minor issues regarding the steam- (and also the gog-)version of the game. It runs using scummvm, which is ok for the most part but it does come with a couple of small annoyances. First off some animations seem to play at a slower rate than I remember them. Not really much of an issue, and since I used to run my original physical copy of the game using dosbox when playing it on a modern machine, it is possible that I actually used to run the game too fast. However I do think this version can look a little choppy at times. And also the game's original save/load-system is now overridden by scummvms own system. So the screen that was originally intended to save the game now isn't accessible anymore, which is a shame because on that same screen you were also able to adjust the volume of background music, voices, and soundeffects independently, a feature that is now missing. (You can now save using f5 and load with f6)

However those are really just nitpicks, and if you want to play this game on a modern machine and for a low price then this is by far the best and easiest way to do so. So go ahead and pick it up already! :)
